main.name: Michael Judge
main.description: I am a 3rd year student at Arcadia University studying Computer Science. I am hoping to go into a career in Cyber Security
main.bio: I have been learning Computer Science for close to 8 years. Throughout my studies I have learned Software Development using Java, Website Developement and Design using HTML and CSS, Database Management using SQL, and Penetration Testing via Kali Linux. My intrests lie mostly with Cyber Security and Software Development and I am always looking to learn more about both subjects.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to send me a message.

resume.skillmessage: I am proficient in languages such as Java. I also have basic knowledge in HTML, CSS, SQL, and Python.

education.description: During school I took many classes teaching a plethora of subjects. I took courses that gave me foundational knowledge in SQL, HTML, CSS, and a basic knowledge in JavaScript. I also took courses that expanded on my knowledge of Java building it to a competent level. I also used various Linux distrobutions in several courses building my knowledge from novice to intermediate.
While in school I took Computer Science courses mostly relating to Software Development using Java.

work.title: Retail Service Associate
work.description: During my time working at Classic Game Junkie I built my knowledge of video game and systems to a point where I could recommend various games and consoles that would best fit a certain person's intrests. While employed at Classic Game Junkie I went from being a Retail Associate to working on repairs for various systems. This gave me an intimate knowledge about how these systems worked and how to diagnose the various issues that would arise. The job also taught me how to solder working on anything from larger contacts to smaller watch battery sized contacts.

work.title: IT Student Assistant
work.description: During my time at Arcadia University while studying Computer Science I also worked part time at the school's IT Helpdesk. At this job I helped troubleshoot various issues that users were having. From issues with the school's software to issues relating to their own personal software or hardware. While working here I was tasked with first triaging support tickets depending on how urgent they were and what type of assistance was needed. Once I had triaged the tickects I was then tasked with responding to the various tickets either solving them myself or gathering information and writing detailed notes regarding the issue so that my superiors could respond and fix the issue.
